item.title: Do Pharmaceutical Companies Publish Biased Research?
item.description: In 2019 I had the opportunity to share some of my research at the American Academy of Neurologists in Philadelphia. Here I’ll provide my poster as well as a few reasons for my excitement about the topic of literature bias in Alzheimer’s Disease. What This Research Contributes: The largest review of Alzheimer’s literature focusing on bias Expands on previous Funding bias research in Alzheimer’s Disease Provides non-anecdotal exploration into Publishing Journal as a source of bias Introduces Author Affiliations as a potential biasing factor Background The concept of literature bias is not new.

item.title: Parallel Plots for Visualizing Inconsistent Temporality of Clinical Trials
item.description: In the pursuit of more data-centric medical decisions, large scale literature reviews are increasingly necessary. However, these literature reviews are far from entertaining and often hard to depict outside of a numeric tables. In this post, I’ll be visualizing hundreds of clinical trials in a single graph to show how it may be possible to use parallel plots as a copmlementary reporting tool for literature reviews. This idea was insipred by an excellent set of plots from 538.
